div1.p: Rose requests news about the yellow fever situation in Peru.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, February 15, 1921

INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
February 15, 1921
My dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
We are today sending you the following
cable:

SHOULD WELCOME INFORMATION CONCERNING
YELLOW FEVER SITUATION ARE YOU RE-
MAINING WITH IT IS FURTHER ASSISTANCE
NEEDED CABLE INTERCOM OUR EXPENSE

As you know we are eager to know if there
is any assistance that the International Health
Board can give in Peru. At the present time we are
bending all our efforts toward the control of yellow
fever in Mexico and Central America. General Lyster
is the director of a “Comision Especial contra la Fiebre
Amarilla”, created by a presidential acuerdo. Doctors
Connor, Caldwell and Vaughn are the other members of this
“Comision” from our staff and there are besides three
representatives of the Mexican Department of Health. The
program seems to be going forward satisfactorily.

While our greatest efforts are now being
exerted in Mexico, we still have great interest in
the situation in Peru. It would be a great comfort
and satisfaction to me to know that you are on the
ground and giving to the situation the benefit of your
knowledge and experience.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose.
P. S. Cables, I understand, have to be prepaid, but
we expect you to allow us to re-imburse you for any
amounts you spend in sending us the information we are
requesting - now or in the future; please use them freely
to keep us in touch
with the situation.
W. R.
Doctor Henry R. Carter
c/o American Consulate
Lima, Peru
